unnormalised: So, someone's asking if online learning in India is actually worth it? Well, lemme tell you as someone who almost failed 12th standard Maths 'cause I was too busy binge-watching cricket matches, the answer is a resounding... maybe?
normalised: So, someone is asking if online learning in India is actually worth it? Well, let me tell you as someone who almost failed twelfth standard Maths because I was too busy binge watching cricket matches, the answer is a resounding... maybe?

unnormalised: See, back in my day (which was, like, 5 years ago, relax), EdTech was just starting. Now it's EVERYWHERE. You got BYJU's trying to teach you everything from A for apple to the whole dang universe. And don't even get me started on Vedantu! I swear, those guys probably offer classes on how to make the perfect chai. Seriously, my little cousin got 98% in her ICSE exams thanks to some online coaching. So, yeah, the *potential* is definitely there.
normalised: See, back in my day which was, like, five years ago, relax, E-d-T-e-c-h was just starting. Now it is EVERYWHERE. You got B-Y-J-U's trying to teach you everything from A for apple to the whole dang universe. And don't even get me started on Vedantu! I swear, those guys probably offer classes on how to make the perfect chai. Seriously, my little cousin got ninety eight percent in her I-C-S-E exams thanks to some online coaching. So, yeah, the potential is definitely there.

unnormalised: But, BUT! And this is a big, Bollywood-drama-sized "but," you gotta be smart about it. Just signing up for any old Rs. 99 course promising you'll become an IIT topper overnight is a recipe for disappointment. You gotta do your research! Read the reviews, check the teacher's qualifications, and most importantly, figure out if you're actually gonna watch the lectures and do the assignments. 'Cause let's be real, it's way easier to open up YouTube than it is to actually, like, learn thermodynamics. I know this from experience, bhai.

Cause let's be real, it is way easier to open up YouTube than it is to actually, like, learn thermodynamics. I know this from experience, bhai.

unnormalised: So, is online learning worth it? If you're serious, disciplined, and pick the right course... ABSOLUTELY. If you're hoping it's gonna magically transform you into a genius while you're still scrolling through Instagram... well, good luck with that. You'll probably end up like me, still googling "how to pass aptitude test" at 30 years old.
